TopicTitle: Laythe Explorer (Incredibly Easy(tm) to control airplane!)

Articles.Content:
Note: Comes in both Stock and Modded Variants

Have you ever wanted a plane of your own, but fed up with trying to build it?

Want one that gets off the ground quickly, but is still controllable?

Well look no further than the X-200 "Laythe Explorer!" (Warranty void if used in atmosphere without oxygen)

This is probably the best plane I have ever built, it is easy to control even without the Avionics Package online! It can recover from the worst of flameout-induced flat spins,

General Stats:

Cruising Altitude: 12000m

Top Speed at Altitude: >800m/s (Encountered on an attempted trip around Kerbin, the max you will probably see is around 600-650)

Takeoff Speed: ~100m/s

Optimum Landing Speed: ~50-60m/s

Range: ~2000 km (Approximately halfway around Kerbin)

Fuel: 1050 L

Consumption Rate: ~0.35 L/s

Stock Features:

Scientific Instruments

Emergency Ejection System (NOTE: Do NOT use the abort action group to deploy the parachute at the same time the cockpit is decoupled, this has a tendency to destroy the parachute and/or cockpit. Use the spacebar instead)

Laythe Explorer Unmodded

Modded Features:

Scientific Intruments

Emergency Ejection System

Basic Lazor System

LIDAR Detection System

Lazor Guided Flight

Resource Transfer

Afterburner

Lazor Camera

Required Mods:

Romfarer Lazor System

Lazor Cam

Laythe Explorer Modded

Screenshots
And how is one supposed to deliver it to Laythe Otherwise very nice and safe to fly plane

And how is one supposed to deliver it to Laythe Otherwise very nice and safe to fly plane

Well, the simplest way is to strap it to a rocket, or if you want to do it in style, I'd go for the interplanetary ring.

Well, the simplest way is to strap it to a rocket, or if you want to do it in style, I'd go for the interplanetary ring.

This is so cool! Mind sharing the .craft file?

Indeed, making a plane is pretty easy. Making a space plane is the tricky part.

Craft files for both craft are here, btw: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/26501-Outsourcing-my-troubleshooting?p=348769&viewfull=1#post348769
